summary: This document is an FBI 302 form summarizing a February 11, 2021 interview with an AUSA (referred to as 'M' or 'IN') regarding a February 29, 2016 meeting where attorneys presented information to the SDNY USAO advocating for a criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The interviewee details the meeting's content, the lack of subsequent investigation, and their recollections about the roles of various attorneys and the mention of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Steve Anthony
persons.context: Mentioned as being on a conference call on February 11, 2021, and as the source of handwritten notes from the February 29, 2016 meeting.

persons.name: Pete Skinner
persons.context: Contacted the interviewee to set up the February 29, 2016 meeting. Attended the meeting and was a friend/former colleague of the interviewee from the SDNY USAO.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attended the February 29, 2016 meeting and did most of the talking. Represented multiple individuals in CVRA civil litigation involving Epstein.

persons.name: Stan Pottinger
persons.context: Attended the February 29, 2016 meeting. Had follow-up email contact with the interviewee in May 2016.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the February 29, 2016 meeting. Attorneys presented information advocating for a criminal investigation into his conduct, described as a long-running pattern of abuse involving multiple girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in passing during the 2016 meeting as someone who worked for or helped Epstein, and potentially as a 'head recruiter'. The interviewee states Maxwell was not the focus of the meeting.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Named as part of Boies Schiller firm. The interviewee states she does not recall ever speaking with or meeting him.

connections.description: Described as friends and former colleagues from their time together at the SDNY USAO.
Edwards was involved in representing multiple individuals in civil litigation, including CVRA cases, against Jeffrey Epstein.
Maxwell was mentioned as someone who had worked for or helped Epstein, and was described as part of 'telling the story' of Epstein's conduct.
Both attorneys attended and presented at the same February 29, 2016 meeting to the SDNY USAO regarding Epstein.
Pottinger had follow-up email contact with the interviewee in May 2016 after the initial meeting.

events.title: Attorney Presentation to SDNY on Epstein
events.description: Attorneys Pete Skinner, Brad Edwards, and Stan Pottinger met with AUSA 'M' at the SDNY USAO to present information advocating for a criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. They discussed civil lawsuits (including CVRA litigation), Epstein's pattern of abuse, and mentioned associates like Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Follow-up Email from Stan Pottinger
events.description: Stan Pottinger sent a follow-up email to AUSA 'M' regarding the Epstein matter, though the interviewee does not recall the specifics.

events.title: FBI Interview of AUSA
events.description: FBI agents and AUSAs conducted a conference call interview with AUSA 'M' to recollect details of the 2016 meeting and subsequent actions regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, USAO SDNY, New York, NY (Location of the February 29, 2016 meeting)
Europe (Mentioned as location of an individual involved in litigation related to Epstein)
Florida / Miami (Referenced regarding the prior Epstein investigation and FBI agents' potential dissatisfaction)
keyFacts: On February 29, 2016, attorneys including Pete Skinner, Brad Edwards, and Stan Pottinger formally presented information to the SDNY USAO advocating for a criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on his pattern of abuse.
The SDNY USAO, after internal discussion and an attempt to verify FBI agent dissatisfaction in Florida, decided not to open an investigation into Epstein following the 2016 meeting.
Ghislaine Maxwell was mentioned in the 2016 meeting as someone who worked for Epstein, but the interviewee emphasized she was not a focus or target of the presentation.
The interviewee (AUSA 'M') strongly refutes claims in Brad Edwards's book and a Daily News article that she expressed confidence a case would be brought, stating she was deliberately non-committal.

No investigation into Epstein or for perjury related to civil depositions was opened by SDNY until after the publication of the Miami Herald series, which caused the interviewee to re-evaluate her prior assumptions.
